resources.string: Cali’s cheerful nature is manifested in salsa, a Caribbean rhythm that is danced here among the sugarcane in its own unique way. In this city, nicknamed "Branch of Heaven,” the peaks of Cristo Rey, the hill of the Three Crosses, and the hills of San Antonio jut upwards from the plains that make up most of Valle del Cauca.

Además de ser uno de los principales centros urbanos, industriales y culturales de Colombia, Cali es un lugar vibrante que anualmente atrae a visitantes de todos los rincones del mundo. ¡Prepara tu viaje con esta guía turística y descubre por qué se dice que el cielo tiene sucursal en Colombia!

Cali, founded in 1536, can be explored on foot: walk under the shade of trees along the riverbank, admire the architecture of churches and other national monuments, and visit the city’s many museums. In Cali, travelers can enjoy music festivals, learn about sugarcane farming, and take in the mountainous landscapes. .

Salsa dancing may seem difficult, especially when it’s performed by master pairs and dance groups that have spent years perfecting their movement, coordination, and speed. There are numerous opportunities in Cali for tourists to try their hand at this energetic dance, as there are a number of dance academies and schools offering lessons tailor-made for beginners. The city has also earned a reputation as a major destination for shopping.

With salsa music always playing in the background, Cali hosts a unique fair and offers a vast array of museums, colonial churches, a zoo, and sites of great environmental importance in the surrounding area.

Cali has no scape to the Colombian trend of growth of urban areas to the damage of rural population, so much the state (and its metropolitan area) doubled its participation in the vallecaucana population and the country, today more than 60% of the population of Valle del Cauca lives in Cali and its metropolitan area.

As for the distribution dela population, Cali is a city inhabited by young people according to statistics from DANE. The major of the population is under 40 years. A larger population of women is also observed in almost all age ranges, except among the younger population, also looks like the average age of women is higher than men\'s.

A highlight of the Cali demographics, and generally in western Colombia, is the highest percentage of Afro-Colombian population, approximately 26%, making Cali one of the Latin American cities with larger black population. The Afro-Colombian influence in the Cali culture is evident in the musical aspects, for example, the city is known for its salsa orchestras.

Esteban Posada Vásquez
